title: Conflict Style

questions.text: When we disagree on something, I'd like us to...
choices: Talk it through right away before it builds up
Take a breather and come back to it when we're calm
Find a middle ground we can both live with
Let the small stuff go - not everything needs a discussion

questions.text: If things get tense between us, what would help me most is...
choices: Staying in the conversation until we work it out
Taking a break and reconnecting when we're both ready
A bit of humor or lightness to ease the tension
Knowing you still love me even when we're frustrated

questions.text: After a disagreement, I usually need...
choices: To resolve it and reconnect quickly
Some time alone to process before coming back together
Reassurance that we're okay
To understand what happened so we can avoid it next time

questions.text: If you're upset with something I did, the best way to tell me is...
choices: Be direct - I'd rather know right away
Give me a heads up that we need to talk, then tell me
Gently, with reassurance that it's not a big deal
With specific examples so I understand what happened

questions.text: When it comes to apologies, I believe...
choices: A quick, sincere sorry goes a long way
Actions matter more than words
I need to understand what I did wrong first
Both people should acknowledge their part

description: Discover how you'll navigate the bumps together.
